Literature.Title: Rombocin, a Short Stable Natural Nisin Variant, Displays Selective Antimicrobial Activity against Listeria monocytogenes and Employs a Dual Mode of Action to Kill Target Bacterial Strains.
Literature.Author: Guo L, Wambui J, Wang C, Broos J, Stephan R, Kuipers OP

Literature.Title: Altering Specificity and Enhancing Stability of the Antimicrobial Peptides Nisin and Rombocin through Dehydrated Amino Acid Residue Engineering.
Literature.Author: Guo L, Stoffels K, Broos J, Kuipers OP

Sequence Information.Target Organism: Lactococcus lactis MG1363(MIC=0.78µg/ml),Listeria monocytogenes LMG 10470(MIC=25µg/ml),Listeria monocytogenes TT82E(MIC=12.5µg/ml),Bacillus cereus CH-85(MIC=25µg/ml),Staphylococcus aureus LMG 10147(MIC=100µg/ml),Staphylococcus aureus LMG 15975(MIC=100µg/ml),Enterococcus faecium LMG 11423(MIC=100µg/ml),Enterococcus faecium LMG 16003(MIC=100µg/ml),Enterococcus faecalis LMG 16216(MIC=50µg/ml),Lactococcus lactis MG1363(MIC=0.65µg/ml)
